00022 #include <stdio.h>
00023 #include <errno.h>
00024 #include <string.h>
00025 #include <sys/stat.h>
00026 #include <assert.h>
00027 
00028 Cleaner::Cleaner(State* state, const BuildConfig& config)
00029   : state_(state)
00030   , verbose_(config.verbosity == BuildConfig::VERBOSE || config.dry_run)
00031   , dry_run_(config.dry_run)
00032   , removed_()
00033 {
00034 }
00035 
00036 bool Cleaner::RemoveFile(const string& path) {
00037   if (remove(path.c_str()) < 0) {
00038     switch (errno) {
00039       case ENOENT:
00040         return false;
00041       default:
00042         Error("remove(%s): %s", path.c_str(), strerror(errno));
00043         return false;
00044     }
00045   } else {
00046     return true;
00047   }
00048 }
00049 
00050 bool Cleaner::FileExists(const string& path) {
00051   struct stat st;
00052   if (stat(path.c_str(), &st) < 0) {
00053     switch (errno) {
00054       case ENOENT:
00055         return false;
00056       default:
00057         Error("stat(%s): %s", path.c_str(), strerror(errno));
00058         return false;
00059     }
00060   } else {
00061     return true;
00062   }
00063 }
00064 
00065 void Cleaner::Report(const string& path) {
00066   if (verbose_)
00067     printf("Remove %s\n", path.c_str());
00068 }
00069 
00070 void Cleaner::Remove(const string& path) {
00071   if (!IsAlreadyRemoved(path)) {
00072     removed_.insert(path);
00073     if (dry_run_) {
00074       if (FileExists(path))
00075         Report(path);
00076     } else {
00077       if (RemoveFile(path))
00078         Report(path);
00079     }
00080   }
00081 }
00082 
00083 bool Cleaner::IsAlreadyRemoved(const string& path) {
00084   set<string>::iterator i = removed_.find(path);
00085   return (i != removed_.end());
00086 }
00087 
00088 void Cleaner::PrintHeader() {
00089   printf("Cleaning...");
00090   if (verbose_)
00091     printf("\n");
00092   else
00093     printf(" ");
00094 }
00095 
00096 void Cleaner::PrintFooter() {
00097   printf("%d files.\n", (int)removed_.size());
00098 }
00099 
00100 void Cleaner::CleanAll() {
00101   PrintHeader();
00102   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = state_->edges_.begin();
00103        e != state_->edges_.end();
00104        ++e)
00105     for (vector<Node*>::iterator out_node = (*e)->outputs_.begin();
00106          out_node != (*e)->outputs_.end();
00107          ++out_node)
00108       Remove((*out_node)->file_->path_);
00109   PrintFooter();
00110 }
00111 
00112 void Cleaner::DoCleanTarget(Node* target) {
00113   if (target->in_edge_) {
00114     Remove(target->file_->path_);
00115     for (vector<Node*>::iterator n = target->in_edge_->inputs_.begin();
00116          n != target->in_edge_->inputs_.end();
00117          ++n) {
00118       DoCleanTarget(*n);
00119     }
00120   }
00121 }
00122 
00123 void Cleaner::CleanTarget(Node* target) {
00124   assert(target);
00125 
00126   PrintHeader();
00127   DoCleanTarget(target);
00128   PrintFooter();
00129 }
00130 
00131 int Cleaner::CleanTargets(int target_count, char* targets[]) {
00132   int status = 0;
00133   PrintHeader();
00134   for (int i = 0; i < target_count; ++i) {
00135     const char* target_name = targets[i];
00136     Node* target = state_->LookupNode(target_name);
00137     if (target) {
00138       if (verbose_)
00139         printf("Target %s\n", target_name);
00140       DoCleanTarget(target);
00141     } else {
00142       Error("unknown target '%s'", target_name);
00143       status = 1;
00144     }
00145   }
00146   PrintFooter();
00147   return status;
00148 }
00149 
00150 void Cleaner::DoCleanRule(const Rule* rule) {
00151   assert(rule);
00152 
00153   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = state_->edges_.begin();
00154        e != state_->edges_.end();
00155        ++e)
00156     if ((*e)->rule_->name_ == rule->name_)
00157       for (vector<Node*>::iterator out_node = (*e)->outputs_.begin();
00158            out_node != (*e)->outputs_.end();
00159            ++out_node)
00160         Remove((*out_node)->file_->path_);
00161 }
00162 
00163 void Cleaner::CleanRule(const Rule* rule) {
00164   assert(rule);
00165 
00166   PrintHeader();
00167   DoCleanRule(rule);
00168   PrintFooter();
00169 }
00170 
00171 int Cleaner::CleanRules(int rule_count, char* rules[]) {
00172   assert(rules);
00173 
00174   int status = 0;
00175   PrintHeader();
00176   for (int i = 0; i < rule_count; ++i) {
00177     const char* rule_name = rules[i];
00178     const Rule* rule = state_->LookupRule(rule_name);
00179     if (rule) {
00180       if (verbose_)
00181         printf("Rule %s\n", rule_name);
00182       DoCleanRule(rule);
00183     } else {
00184       Error("unknown rule '%s'", rule_name);
00185       status = 1;
00186     }
00187   }
00188   PrintFooter();
00189   return status;
00190 }
